definition: to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)

sentences.english: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem twenty-nine years.
sentences.chinese: 他登基的時候年二十五歲，在耶路撒冷作王二十九年。

sentences.english: The emperor abdicated in favor of his son.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝自願退位，由他的兒子登基。

sentences.english: Joash was seven years old when he began to reign.
sentences.chinese: 約阿施登基的時候年方七歲。

sentences.english: When he rose to the throne in 1736, the Qianlong Emperor was 25 years old.
In the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel, Asa began to reign over Judah.
sentences.chinese: 以色列王耶羅波安二十年，亞撒登基作猶大王。

sentences.english: Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem sixteen years. Unlike David his father, he did not do what was right in the eyes of the Lord .
sentences.chinese: 亞哈斯登基的時候年二十歲，在耶路撒冷作王十六年。

sentences.english: Amon was twenty and two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned two years in Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 亞們登基的時候年二十二歲，在耶路撒冷作王二年。

sentences.english: When his father died Canute was proclaimed, King of England.
sentences.chinese: 他的父親逝世後，他便宣佈登基爲英格蘭國王。

sentences.english: That in those days, when the king Ahasuerus sat on the throne of his kingdom, which was in Shushan the palace
sentences.chinese: 亞哈隨魯王在書珊城的宮登基。

sentences.english: In the seventh year of Jehu Jehoash began to reign; and forty years reigned he in Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 耶戶第七年，約阿施登基，在耶路撒冷作王四十年。

sentences.english: In the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam, Abijah began to reign over Judah.
sentences.chinese: 耶羅波安王十八年，亞比雅登基作猶大王。

sentences.english: He abjured the Protestant faith and became King in 1594.
sentences.chinese: 他放棄了新教信仰，於1594年登基爲王。

sentences.english: Sixteen years old was he when he began to reign, and he reigned two and fifty years in Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 他登基的時候年十六歲，在耶路撒冷作王五十二年。

sentences.english: In the seventh year of Jehu, Joash became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem forty years.
sentences.chinese: 耶戶第七年，約阿施登基，在耶路撒冷作王四十年。

sentences.english: In the seventh year of Jehu, Joash became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem forty years.
sentences.chinese: 耶戶第七年，約阿施登基，在耶路撒冷作王四十年。

sentences.english: Josiah was eight years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem thirty-one years.
sentences.chinese: 約西亞登基的時候年八歲，在耶路撒冷作王三十一年。

definition: to confer a title on (an empress or a prince)
Taishang Huang/Retired Emperor/father of the reigning emperor/fig. puppet master
